toc_entry.title: Invasion Of the Cable Snatchers
toc_entry.description: In Texas the best way to get rich in cable television is to know just a little about TV and everything about politics.

toc_entry.title: No More Mr. Nice Guy
toc_entry.description: Straight out of the last century, fists swinging, cutting a swath through the lawless, comes Dick Cockrell.

toc_entry.title: Termite Watkins And the Fatal Pancakes
toc_entry.description: In a big fight you can outwit, outhit, or outlast your opponent. But you’d better not try to outeat him.

toc_entry.title: Horse Power
toc_entry.description: Horses are expensive, finicky, and a pain to groom. They are also irresistible.

toc_entry.title: An American Family
toc_entry.description: Pedro Martinez, with only his Mexican heritage, a determination to work hard, and a desire for a better life, brought his family across the Rio Grande to find a home in a new land.

toc_entry.title: The Law West Of the Trinity
toc_entry.description: Justices of the peace, maligned since the days of Roy Bean, don’t operate like other judges. But if lawyers want to get rid of them, they can’t be all bad.

toc_entry.title: Alias Miss Moonlight
toc_entry.subtitle: Stepping Out
toc_entry.description: For Maxine, Texas’ leading gossip, life is all work and no playcation.

toc_entry.title: One Man’s Music
toc_entry.subtitle: Country Notes
toc_entry.description: Harmony begins at home.

toc_entry.title: The Egg War
toc_entry.subtitle: Cityview
toc_entry.description: Getting a memorial for austin’s Viet Nam War dead began as a noble venture but ended in a trivial skirmish.

toc_entry.title: Amens And Imams
toc_entry.subtitle: Church
toc_entry.description: Pentecostal revivalists bask in the Spirit of the Holy Ghost; Muslims find solace in the will of allah.

toc_entry.title: Russian Unorthodox
toc_entry.subtitle: Art
toc_entry.description: The USSR today wouldn’t tolerate the radical art that was nurtured during the Russian Revolution.

toc_entry.title: The Secret Life Of Chester Seltzer
toc_entry.subtitle: Books
toc_entry.description: Gordon Baxter’s Village Creek is just barely navigable. Amado Muro was a bohemian before it was fashionable.

toc_entry.title: Theater In a Suitcase
toc_entry.subtitle: Theater
toc_entry.description: On its Houston stop, the acting Company unpacked performances for Texas theaters to live up to. Austin’s Center Stage is in the know but lacks the how.

toc_entry.title: Brains, Beauty, And Braun
toc_entry.subtitle: Film
toc_entry.description: The Marriage of Maria Braun marks a second honeymoon for the New German Cinema; it’s hard to see your way through The Fog; this american Gigolo is overpriced and underwhelming.

toc_entry.title: Behind the Lines
toc_entry.description: No news is bad news.

toc_entry.title: The Inside Story
toc_entry.description: Black and brown.

toc_entry.title: The Roar Of the Crowd
toc_entry.description: Baby boom, bum rap, race trap.

toc_entry.title: Touts
toc_entry.description: Docs, rocks, and flocks.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A guide to entertainment and events of more than usual interest.

toc_entry.title: Reporter
toc_entry.description: Del Monte gets steamed up over spinach; an entrepreneur’s scheme goes up in flames; Marlin takes the geothermal plunge; football is hot stuff in Mexico.

toc_entry.title: Texas Monthly Puzzle
toc_entry.description: Ticket to write.

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: Texas witches need regulation; the Killer Bees sting again; a cloud hangs over the Contemporary arts Museum; the feds insist that minority rules.
